Author: Michael Stapelberg
Comment:
In .c files, we use /*, in .h files we use /**. This is for doxygen, a tool to generate “documentation” (well, a function reference in our case) from C code.

Also, the comments don’t match — please fix this. The .h file and the .c file should have exactly the same comment.

Author: Michael Stapelberg
Comment:
Please add it in the next version of this patch :).

Also, can you shed some light on why/how this fixes the eclipse problems precisely, please?

Author: Tony Crisci
Comment:
This does not fix the Eclipse problem (#882 is just for respecting Motif hints), but it does remove the i3 decorations from the Eclipse overlay windows.

Originally I thought I could fix the Eclipse problem with Motif hints, but it seems like that is not possible. That will require implementing either an alpha channel for transparency or double buffering.
